lead_paragraph: Despite having her training interrupted by treatment for a hip injury, the marathon world-record holder Paula Radcliffe was selected for Britain’s team for the Beijing Olympics. Radcliffe, 34, failed to finish the marathon in Athens four years ago even though she was one of the favorites. She won the New York City Marathon in November — which served as her Olympic qualifying time — but a toe injury forced her to miss the London Marathon last month.
